title: Tresillian River Walk Route

images.title: Fred James / St Clement and the Tresillian River
images.caption: St Clement and the Tresillian River

images.title: Flappy Pigeon, CC BY-SA 4.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/4.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Tresillian River

images.title: Rod Allday / Looking across the Tresillian River in evening sun
images.caption: Looking across the Tresillian River in evening sun. Seen from the causeway.

images.title: Rod Allday / Footbridge at the end of the causeway
images.caption: Footbridge at the end of the causeway. There is a causeway across this arm of the creek and the watercourse is channelled under this bridge.

images.title: Kevin Fusher / Waterfall Pencallenick Gardens
images.caption: Waterfall Pencallenick Gardens. The Duchy of Cornwall allows access into the now overgrown gardens of Pencallenick school. This little waterfall flows down through two silted ponds and then into the Tressillian river

images.title: Rod Allday / Tidal mud flats on the Tresillian River
images.caption: Tidal mud flats on the River. Looking North towards Tresillian village.

images.title: Tony Atkin / The Tidal Tresillian River
images.caption: The river at low tide.

images.title: Situation / The Tresillian River, tributary of the Truro River Cornwall
images.caption: Looking north-east (upstream), just behind the village of Tresillian towards the bridge. Upper reaches of the river, but still tidal, there are small flat-fish on the river bed. Opposite bank is Duchy of Cornwall land.

description: This walk visits the Tresillian River near the city of Truro in Cornwall. You can park at the public car park in St Clement to start the walk. It's a pleasant spot located just over a mile east of Truro city centre. From here you can pick up a peaceful riverside path heading north to the village of Tresillian. Here you'll find the tidal river which is a tributary of the Truro River. If you continue north along the river you will come to the village of Ladock where you can enjoy some quiet woodland trails in Ladock Woods. If you head south you could visit Malpas - see the video below for details of this alternative route.
